subSubSection.paragraph: Best identified by structures of the male genitalia as illustrated by Collin (1966) and Canzoneri and Meneghini (1983) under the name Hydrellia flaviceps (auct. nec Meigen).

First recorded from Finland by
Zatwarnicki and Kahanpaeae (2014)
. Widespread in Europe and probably across the Palaearctic Region, but poorly known ( Zatwarnicki 2013 ).
